block.p: Investors who accuse a corporation's officers or primary stockholders of profiting from insider information do not lose the right to sue when the corporation merges with another, the Supreme Court has ruled.
The Court on Monday unanimously upheld the right of Ira Mendell, a former investor in Viacom International Inc., to sue.
Mr. Mendell accused a group of Viacom stockholders of using insider information to make $11 million in profits in 1986. He sued the group in Federal District Court in Manhattan in 1987.
